content.description: Starts in an obvious right leaning crack. Pull small roof. Tan Rock.
content.location: This route is left of Julius Squeezer and both start from a ledge on the left side of the Roman Wall.

content.description: Trend right to ledge then move back left to fun column using pockets and good edges. At small roof, dodge right, then straight up to anchor.
content.location: Left side of wall, about 15 feet right of Julius Squeezer. Route starts in a small depression in the talus field.

content.description: Head up to first bolt using small undercling to reach hold out right (first crux). Keep moving right using body tension and balance. Head back left at third bolt through good holds to a seemingly blank open book (second crux) above the ledge. Squirm and stem toward roof then move left to small ledge. One final rightward traverse, then push straight through headwall to anchor.
content.location: Begins about 20-30 feet right of Trajan's Column.

content.description: Boulder up to a big ledge, then climb fun, easy rock to a funky ledge move. Surmount ledge with small holds, body tension, heel hooks, and/or magic to anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts to fixed anchor (shares anchor with Remus).
content.location: Furthest left of the four routes on the western part of the wall.

content.description: Scramble up a slot to a big ledge below a bolt. Powerful moves off the ledge gets you to easier climbing above and then a shallow diehedral with technical moves. Move up towards left side of mini-roof, then make long reach left to good holds. This section is the crux.
Scramble up to big ledge via direct boulder start to where first bolt awaits. Hard bouldery moves off of ledge gets you to easier climbing above and then to the tricky ledge move below the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts to fixed anchor (shares with Romulus).

content.description: Climb a huecoed arete to a wide crack surrounded by a pocketed face. Surmount a small roof and finish on an even smaller roof and crack. Magnifico!
Clip first bolt of Trajan's Column and fire up a steepening slab to a big, fun hueco. Pull through mini-roofs on good holds and finish with a right-sweeping crack to anchor.
content.location: Same start as Trajan's Column but head straight up at first bolt instead of veering left.

content.description: From the ledge, move up and right on crimpers and mostly good feet. First crux is between second and third bolt. Second crux is moving above third bolt. Finish on solid jugs and a nice sidepull that gets you to anchor.
content.protection: 5 SS bolts to SS anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Route is immediately right of Julius Squeezer. Start on ledge. Stay off of huecos of J-Squeezer for full value.

content.description: Climb funky shattered rock with awkward, but positive holds to a ledge below anchor. Use body tension and stemming to reach anchor.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
